subject: HORSE RACING
KENTUCKY DERBY
lead_paragraph: For a trainer who had to wait 14 years between major victories -- what passes for an eternity in horse racing -- Patrick Byrne looked strangely calm after winning the $1 million Florida Derby at Gulfstream Park last month. If he looked like a man who had been there before, it was because he had. When Byrne's front-running colt Take Charge Indy upset a field that included the possible Kentucky Derby favorite Union Rags on March 31, longtime followers of American horse racing were probably left wondering where the trainer had been all these years.
snippet: In the Kentucky Derby on Saturday, the fleet-footed Take Charge Indy could help Patrick Byrne return to the heights he knew in the late 1990s.
